module.p: -(e)an is a suffix used to create masculine derived common nouns from adjectives and from other nouns.

De-adjectival examples –
ciar dusky ⇒ ciaran dusky thing
mòr big, large ⇒ mòran large quantity

De-nominal diminutives –
loch lake ⇒ lochan pond
feur grass (genitive feòir) ⇒ feòirnean blade of grass, shrew
moll chaff (genitive muill) ⇒ muillean piece of chaff, husk
sleamhainn slippery ⇒ sleamhnag slide ⇒ sleamhnagan stye (swelling on the eye)
